what: State Machines for Extracting the Layout of Tables in R
title: State Machines for Extracting the Layout of Tables in R
text: Read amateurish spreadsheets figure tidy .

title: State Machines for Extracting the Layout of Tables in R
text: can install development version smeltr GitHub :

title: State Machines for Extracting the Layout of Tables in R
text: Many spreadsheets come nested headings wide, rather tidy, layouts. example, Federal government makes monthly reports FAFSA® Completion High School Public School District. spreadsheets many complicated rows headers, can see . top rows Federal spreadsheet FAFSA completion WY
code: "extdata" |>     system.file("WY.xls",                 package = "smeltr") |>     smeltr::extract_headers_from_sheet(.sheet = "WY School Level Data",                                        .nrows = 4) |>     dplyr::select(-2) |>     dplyr::mutate(         dplyr::across(tidyselect::starts_with("Row"),                       \(.)stringr::str_replace_all(., "\\n", "; "))     ) |>     tidyr::fill(tidyselect::starts_with("Row"), .direction = "down") |>     knitr::kable()
